sourcesContent:
import React, { Component } from 'react'; import ComponentsSidebar from '../shared/ComponentsSidebar'; export class Toast extends Component { render() { return (
Components UI Elements Toast

Toast

Basic Example

Toasts are as flexible as you need and have very little required markup. At a minimum, we require a single element to contain your “toasted” content and strongly encourage a dismiss button.

Notification
11 mins ago
Hello, world! This is a toast message.
{/* demo-static-toast */}
Translucent

Toasts are slightly translucent, too, so they blend over whatever they might appear over.

Notification
11 mins ago
Hello, world! This is a toast message.
{/* demo-static-toast */}
Stacking

When you have multiple toasts, we default to vertiaclly stacking them in a readable manner.

Notification
Just now
See? Just like this.
{/* toast */}
Notification
11 mins ago
Hello, world! This is a toast message.
{/* demo-static-toast */}
Placement

Place toasts with custom CSS as you need them. The top right is often used for notifications, as is the top middle.

Notification
11 mins ago
Hello, world! This is a toast message.
{/* demo-static-toast */}
{/* az-content-body */}
{/* container */}
) } } export default Toast
